intro: Melhania malacochlamys, commonly known as the Malacochlamys morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple, often with a distinctive bilobed corolla. Its vines can grow up to several meters in length, climbing or trailing along supports. The leaves are heart-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
